content: Yes, that's a great interpretation! The concept of a "near-life experience" can certainly be interpreted in different ways, but the idea of struggling to feel fully alive and finding moments that bring us closer to that feeling is a powerful one. It's also interesting to consider the contrast with a "near-death experience," which often involves a sudden and intense rush of feeling alive in the face of mortality, whereas a "near-life experience" may involve a slower and more gradual process of discovering what truly makes us feel alive.
